project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS: 
- Include in the URL
- In addition to the selected status of an issue

Discussion:
Selection states across tiered items: parent/child - 
Mimic some common approaches like mail clients - folder can be selected, when child item is selected, folder has a "secondary selection" that shows it is still active,  but not the active selection.

Bringing up details - 
Thinking about this further in light of showing the Epic "details" on the right, I don't think we want to do this on Select of the Epic.  That should be a primary action that is to filter the backlog list.

It may be worthwhile to add a "details" affordance though to manually display the issue details for an epic (just not on epic selection).   I'll add that to the next iteration of the design.
fields.summary: Make selected status of Epic remembered

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS: 
- Not included in URL
- Does store expanded state of multiple Epics
fields.summary: Make expanded status of Epic sticky

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- Green is the sum of the estimate value for the completed stories, the line (unfilled section) is the sum of the estimate value for the incompleted stories
- Tooltip shows both estimate sums and %'s
- Put in expanded Epic information panel 

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: How will this handle filtered issues?
A: (x) Doesn't change 

Q: What happens to the bar if there is no estimation statistic for the board?
A: (x) There always is

Q: What if a non-story points estimate is chosen?
A: (x) The bar should represent the completed % of whatever estimate statistic is used. 

Q: What if there are no stories to estimate, or there's only 1?
A: (x) If there are no stories it shows as completed (nothing left outstanding right?) If there are no stories estimated it shows as completed unless the estimation statistic is issue count. If there's one story with an estimate incompleted it shows as empty. 

Q: What about the estimates on subtasks? Are those summed as well?
A: (x) No. These are used only for remaining estimate. 

Q: Does the bar update if an invalid estimate is entered?
A: (x) No

Q: Does the bar update on estimate change of a story in the sprint?
A: (x) You can't change an estimate of a story in a sprint once it's started. If it hasn't started then yes.

Q: Does the bar update on drag of a story into the sprint? 
A: (x) No, only on stories being completed or added into an epic.
fields.summary: Implement the estimate done vs estimate undone progress bar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- Coloured section of bar is the number of issues that have an estimate applied, uncoloured (line) section of the bar is the count of issues with no estimate applied 
- Tooltip shows both issue counts and %'s
- Put in expanded Epic information panel unestimated and estimated

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: How will this handle filtered issues?
A: Ignores filtering

Q: What if there are no stories in the epic, or only 1?
A: The bar will not show for zero, will be small if % is small

Q: What if no estimate statistic is selected for the board?
A: One is always selected

Q: What if stories are removed from the sprint?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens when the last one gets removed?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: And another one added after that?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Implement estimated vs unestimated stories progress bar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Minimum Criteria: 
- Cross on booger
- No warning on removal

-Goal is to work with design to actually design this before implementation-

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Who can remove from an epic?
A: (/) Only the admin

Q: What if the epic itself is deleted? Are stories automatically unassigned from it?
A: (/) Yes

Q: What if the issue is not currently visible due to filter/column mapping?
A: (/) If an issue is not visible, you have no mechanism to unassigne it
fields.summary: Allow a story to be unassigned from any Epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Make sure open drop down handles 
(x) Epics panel closing
(x) dragging issues within backlog and to epics
(x) quick/instant filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS: 
- Epic should not be in the backlog list
- When starting a sprint Epics are NOT included

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Check that Epics are not draggable into the backlog area.
A: if the epics feature is enabled, no epic is available in the backlog list and then you can not drag and drop it. If the feature is disabled then you can drag and drop the epics like any issue type (bug, story etc.)
fields.summary: Make sure that Epics do not get included in to the sprint (at the moment they are in the backlog and get put in to a sprint)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What does temporary mean and how will a user know that? If they get used to it, and it disappears, they will be >:/
A: (/) that's why it's Labs™

Q: Does this interact with the Epics sidebar twixie?
A: (x) The toggle menu state reflects the current state of the Epic Panel (see GHS-6179)

Q: If so, do they play nicely together?
A: (x) Yes

Q: Does hide/show mean the entire panel and twixie go away, or does it actually mean expand/collapse?
A: (x) Expand/Collapse

Q: Must test with all states of pan mode: Epics expanded/collapsed/populated/un-populated, backlog empty/filled, detail view open/closed
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens when jumping to Work and Report mode and back?
A: (x) Persists

Q: Is this persisted across logins/users?
A: (x) I think each user should own his/her own state

Q: Who has permission to do this? Can non-admin or anonymous users do this?
A: (x) Anyone
fields.summary: Temporary tools menu option to hide/show Epics (only on plan mode)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Need to test all states: Matrix of Epics open/populated, issues in backlog exist/don't exist, and Detail view open/closed/help text
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Check above at minimum resolution
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Look for overlapping panels, and try with long but reasonable length data in relevantly displayed fields.
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Plan mode layout for 3 panels (to bring in the closable detail view and allow closable Epic panel)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS: 
- Add flag
- Wrap existing prototype code with a check for the flag
- Convert the creation of Epic related fields to be on the switch of this flag as opposed to the current update task approach

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What happens to Epics fields if Labs is disabled after enabling?
A: The fields remain in the system, as we don't delete fields

Q: What if those fields are deleted after Labs is disabled?
A: The field won't be recreated as it isn't used anymore

Q: And what if a user again re-enables Labs?
A: All missing fields are created/recreated upon first usage

Q:If Epic Labs is disabled, can I still interact with previously created Epics?
A: Yes, but they show up as normal issues inside the backlog
fields.summary: Create labs feature to enable Epic support

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Scenario:

- user {{test}} is the project lead and is part of the project role Administrators on a given project, but is not a member of the {{administrators}} group
- user {{test}} creates a board that retrieves issues from project "X" and shares the board with project "X"
- the user creates three issues on project X and add label {{something}} to them
- The issues are displayed on the backlog and the "Create Sprint" button is enabled
- user {{test}} edits the filter used by the board. It changes from:

{code:sql}
project = X ORDER BY RANK ASC
{code}

to:

{code:sql}
project = X or labels = something ORDER BY RANK ASC
{code}

The "Create Sprint" (Plan mode) and "Complete Sprint" (Work mode) buttons are not available to the user.

If the {{labels}} are removed from the search or the user is added to the {{administrators}} group, the buttons are enabled again.

This happens because the project context is 'global', i.e the JQL does not show which project is needed. 

I am raising this as a bug because I believe this should take under consideration the results retrieved by the search and not the search itself. In the scenario above only issues from project X are retrieved and even having the necessary permission to create sprints or to close them, the user is unable to do it.
fields.summary: Using labels in the new board filter restrict users from performing certain tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: greenhopper is unusable.
fields.summary: layout bug in greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I often need to browse through issues that belong to a column, or even a "cell" (intersection of column and swim lane). I can do this with "j" and "k" on the RapidBoard.
Unfortunately, the Details view of the RapidBoard isn't very practical: you don't see all information at a glance (I need to see at least summary + priority + description + affects/fix version) because they are dispatched to tabs. Therefore, I need to open each issue using "o" and then return to the RapidBoard to move to the next issue.

It'd be much more practical to be able to navigate between issues directly in the View Issue screen.

Incidentally, this capability already exists for search results. A simple solution would therefore be to leverage this feature by opening issues from the RapidBoard _in a search context_ corresponding to the JQL query that "defines" the contents of the current "cell".

Or you could port the "Issue Navigator" button that existed in each column of the classic GH task boards to the RapidBoard.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to navigate in View Issue mode between issues of the same RapidBoard "cell"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What happens if this field is deleted/removed from the screen?
A: It won't appear on the screen.

Q: What if it is renamed?
A: In theory, it should just display with the new name but atm, GH blows up and disables itself. See subtask GHS-6162. 

Q: What if the field's permissions are modified?
A: It doesn't show up. 

Further testing notes:
- the field is added to the screen for the create issue operation for the epic issue type
- it's not added to screens within an issue type screen scheme that is not associated to any projects
- if there is a specific screen scheme for epics, it's only added to those screens - otherwise screens within the default scheme

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When sub-task is created using the Create Sub-Task button on the View Issue screen and Greenhopper is enabled, the parent Fix Version is set on the Sub-Task, even though the Fix Version field was blank on the Sub-Task creation.

If Greenhopper is disabled, Fix Version is not set, as expected.

Tested using Greenhopper 6.0.3
fields.summary: Sub-task inherits parent fix-version when GreenHopper is enabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have a rank order, setup as described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ranking+Issues+in+GreenHopper+Classic

This has stopped working in 6.0.2.  I tried both the Classic board as well as setting up a new Agile Board (as it seems you are moving away from Classic Boards) and cannot get Drag and Drop to dictate rank order.  I can drag between columns for status, but not to modify rank order.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It is an expected behavior whereby the *Subtasks* should follow the *Parent Issue* when the ranking is changed for *GreenHopper* and that is how the *Ranking* concept is implemented. Eventhough that it may not be the case all the time but that is the architecture of *GreenHopper* by default. However, it would be handy to have the flexibility of drag-and-drop issues, regardless of the level.

Example: If you change the ranking of a parent issue the subtasks will be moved also. This may not always be the case.
fields.summary: Issue Ranking for all User Issues regardless the level (Parent Issue, Sub-tasks)

* Leave it for >15 mins. The wallboard is not refreshed.

* Refreshing the whole browser:
!refreshed.png!

Hello team,

We understand that GreenHopper considers the rightmost column as "DONE", the leftmost column as "To Do" and any columns, no matter how many, in between those as "In Progress" and we would like to have the ability to choose which columns should be mapped to "To Do" or "Done".

Please find an attached screenshot for further reference.

Thanks!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi

We're having a difficult time trying to organize our tickets using the new planning board. Issues such as: 
- Who is working on what
- How high priority is this ticket and where should it go in the queue
- What part of the project(s) is this ticket from

We have had to start putting a lot of this information in the issue title
e.g. AP : <PRODUCT NAME> : <FEATURE NAME> : <User story> and I still cannot see easily who the ticket is assigned to.

All the cool dropdowns Jira comes with to distinguish the issue go out the window with this new planning board.

Cheers
Bjorn
fields.summary: As a User, I can see the project, component, priority, assignee and title of the story on the planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the Structure plugin, we would like to tap into Rapid Boards configuration, namely:
- get a list of rapid boards
- get rapid board filter, sub-filter, ranking field, estimation method
- get quick filters set up for the rapid boards

Other things like swimlane configurations will be nice to have as well, although currently not needed in our plugin.

Having this feature will allow us to more tightly integrate Structure with Rapid Board - for example, synchronize rank changes only for those issues that are on the rapid board.

Thanks!
Igor
fields.summary: As a JIRA plugin developer, I would like to access Agile Board configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6053].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when the swimlanes are based on Stories, issues without sub-tasks are shown at the bottom.

h3. Suggested Solution
* It would be a great feature if they were shown on top, or to have the option to display at the bottom or top, similar to the behavior when grouping the by Assignee that you can choose if the Unassigned issues will be placed on the top or on the bottom.
* Issues should appear in rank order in the work board, irrespective of whether or not swimlanes are used for subtasks, and regardless of whether the issue has any subtasks.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: When basing swimlanes by Stories it would be a great feature to choose where issues without sub-tasks will be shown.

fields.description:
Currently there is no technical connection between priority and ranking whereas some users are tempted to set priority to some value which is just disregarded in Agile views.
On the other hand, there is no possibility to influence the ranking in the detail/edit views of the issue nor on the issue navigator level.

An idea could also be to have a functionality to just reorder the backlog by priority.

Product Owner wants to use Rapid Board's Planing view to drag issues from backlog to a sprint. She doesn't want to see closed or resolved issues in a backlog.

Developer wants to use Rapid Board's Work view to track her work progress. She want to see every closed or resolved issue as long as the issue is in the sprint.

fields.description:
h2. Acceptance Criteroa (in addition to GHS-6044)

* For highlighting quick filters, I can select a field (for example due date), which is shown in the list of PBIs
* This field only shows when highlight filter query is active, so that ui is not cluttered
* This field could even replace the estimate field while the hightlight quick filter is active

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Acceptance Criteria
* Quick Filters can be toggled to highlight rather than filter. Options depending on usability considerations:
** either in the creation screen (=> something is either a quick filter or a quick highlight)
** or in the plan view itself (=> quickfilter can be used eithier for filterering or highlighting)
* Plan views shows highlighted and non-highlighted items, ranking is possible between these
* I can highlight, for example
** duedate <= "4w"
** priority = Blocker
** risk >= 5
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to highlight rather than filter certain Product Backlog Items in Plan View so that I can still rank PBI in comparison to unhighlighted PBI

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have not verified this, but I experienced it on JAC once.

I have a board open in one browser window always.
In another window I opened JAC and I was logged out, so I logged back in.
Then later, I went back to the board, and the board auto-refreshed. The data loaded fine.
But then later I tried to transition an issue, but I got the "Token expired retry" dialog.

Not sure if we can do anything about this when doing our polling for staleness, but if we can that might be good.
fields.summary: XSRF Token is out of date after being logged out and logged in and seeing board refresh

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is something I found randomly and I guess it makes sense for us to check. I tried this on a clean installation and reproduced many times in different ways. In a nutshell, I think the shortest path to demonstrate is the following:

# Let us say I have a project named _ABC_ and a Rapid Board _ABC Board_ containing issues from that project.
# I also have two users:
## charlie: All permissions on project ABC
## alpha: Only in jira-users, essentially only able to create issues in ABC (user has been added specifically in this example but it would work for him anyway):
!1-alphagroups.png!
!2-createissues.png!
# Project roles in ABC are like the following:
!3-people.png!
# charlie creates ABC-1:
!4-create.png!
# Then charlie adds ABC-1 to Sprint 1 (just created by him, also):
!5-plan.png!
# The sprint id for that sprint is 1 (the address bar is from the sprint report):
!6-sprintId.png!
# The Sprint field is also visible on all screens:
!7-sprintfield.png!
# Now user _alpha_ tries to create an issue in JIRA. Remember that he cannot even browse project ABC but he can edit the Sprint Field and add the sprint id (1, in this case):
!8-alphacreatesissue.png!
# ... so when he tries to view ABC-2 he cannot:
!9-permissionviolation.png!
# However, ABC-2 has been added to the sprint:
!10-issueadded.png!

Should this be possible? Am I missing something, perhaps?
fields.summary: Restrict editing of the Sprint CF to users with Schedule permission for that issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The new planning board is great and solves many of our cross project type of problems. Thank you very much! However when using the new view we divide out backlogs into sprints instead of dividing the backlog using different versions in the classic planning board. The new view is much more easy to work with especially the simplicity to do re-planning (change sprint velocity) just by dragging and dropping the bottom part of the sprint boxes. However we lost one very important thing moving from Fix-version to the new artifact “Sprint” and that is the visibility of the future plan of a backlog items. 

Problem
When requesting information about an Issue (User Story), the Agile Panel on the issue view page contains information regarding only the started or completed sprints in which the issue has been planned. For us and I do think for others as well it is crucial to know when an Issue (User Story) has been planned in the future.

Feature request
We really need to be able to be able to find out the name of a sprint to which and Issue have been assign even though the sprint is not yet started. The information is needed both in the issue browser view and in the REST API.

Thank you,
Petru
fields.summary: Get Sprint information for Issues assigned to planned (not started) Sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: At the moment there is no option to print a report from report view in Greenhopper. It would be nice to have that option so that users can print reports directly.
fields.summary: Add option to print JIRA Software reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the Velocity Chart is hardcoded to show (max) last 7 sprints. Looking at the average amount of work completed in a sprint is the main value of the Velocity Chart, so the value of the Velocity Chart increases with every sprint, because the average is getting better. 

If you have Sprint of two weeks length, you are talking about only 3-4 months. If vacation or christmas time is in between, you average is getting poor.

Therefore the limitation to show only last 7 sprints is bad and should be removed.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart should show all Sprints and not be limited to last 7 Sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: An exception has occurred in http://localhost:2990/jira/s/en_USs7667o-418945332/809/5/6.0.5-SNAPSHOT/_/download/resources/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-rapid/ChartUtils.js at 48 : Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of null
fields.summary: Exception flashes when loading board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The new *GreenHopper 6.0.2* features the removal of the board selection drop-down which is implemented for performance as mentioned in the following:
- [Navigation change yields faster performance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.0.2+Release+Notes#GreenHopper6.0.2ReleaseNotes-Navigationchangeyieldsfasterperformance]

However, it will be good if the board selection is still available since some users are used to it. Perhaps an option to *enable* or *disable* it would also be feasible.
fields.summary: Agile Drop Down list of the Boards selection

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please check the attached screenshots suggesting different improvements for the Sprint Report.
fields.summary: Improvements for Burndown Report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
While setting the swimlanes and Quick Filters ordered by another field (e.g. Priority ASC or DESC) does not work as it seems to inherit Rank order from the Rapid Board main filter.

See attached screenshots:

h5. Rapid Board Filter
!Rapid Board Filter.png|thumbnail!

h5. Swimlane Filter
!Swimlane Filter.png|thumbnail!

h5. Quick Filter
!Quick Filter.png|thumbnail!

h5. Work Swimlane
!Work Swimlane.png|thumbnail!

h5. Work Quick Filter
!Work Quick FIlter.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Swimlanes and Quick Filters order by other fields do not work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When auto assign in Greenhopper configuration is checked, the following behaviour would be occur:

# Check Auto Assign under Greenhopper configuration
# Create a new card
# By default, assignee field is auto assign
# Change the assignee to any user
# Change it back to auto assign
# Create the card
# The assignee will become *Unassigned*

This behaviour will occur even with the *Unassigned feature* turned *off* in JIRA.
fields.summary: Auto Assign not working well in card creation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As shown in [CAC|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Sprint+Report] (in the screenshot), Story points edits are not shown in the Sprint Report for issues that were added after Sprint Start date.

However, this is not explicitly mentioned (or I could not find it, at least) and it seems to create some confusion.

This seems to be expected behavior so [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Story+Points+Not+Shown+in+the+Sprint+Report] has been created to level things out, for now.

Also, [this JAC ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6025] has been created on behalf of the customer in order to verify this is, indeed, expected behavior.

If this proves to be the case, do you think we could include a note in the documentation and perhaps get rid of my KB article?

(A small note: on the CAC page there is a screenshot where every issue with an asterisk does not have story points which threw me off at first)
fields.summary: Story Points Not Shown in the Sprint Report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Story points not shown in Sprint Report when issue is edited after Sprint Start Date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the end of the sprint any incomplete issues are automatically moved into the top of the ‘next sprint’ instead of the backlog. Your documentation specifies that At the end of the sprint any incomplete issues will automatically be moved back to the top of the backlog.

See attachment, ST-71

kind regards
Michelle 

It would be useful to be able to choose where the incomplete issues go, if you want them moved to the next planned sprint or the backlog.
fields.summary: At the end of the sprint any incomplete issues are automatically moved into the top of the ‘next sprint’ instead of the backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I often want to use my browsers find-on-page (Ctrl-F) functionality in order to search the contents of a ticket.  When viewing issue details on the Rapid Board I cannot do this effectively because the information is located across many distinct tabs.  All information should be shown in a single view.  Retainin the option of using tab-like or index UI elements to jump to a section in the issue content would be acceptable and useful.
fields.summary: As a GH user, I would like to be able to view all content on a ticket without having to click through tabs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As an additional benefit to Scrum and Kanban users as well as those just organizing their tasks in JIRA it should be possible to view issues in the issue navigator and to re-order their GreenHopper Rank order via drag-and-drop.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I would like to reorder my issues from the Issue Navigator

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It is already possible to collapse started sprints on the Plan board.  The functionality should be extended to not-yet-started sprints.
fields.summary: As a scrum planner and GH Classic user, I should be able to collapse not-yet-started sprints on the Plan board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be extremely useful to be able to reorder sprints on the Plan board.  Changing the sprint order would swap the relative order of all of the issues contained in those sprints.

In addition to improving Scrum planning, this would resolve a critical missing feature available in the Classic boards where the Version cards could be re-ordered by giving equivalent functionality in the Rapid Board.
fields.summary: As a scrum planner I would like the ability to reorder sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
While viewing an issue via the standard JIRA page I would like a control next to "View on Rapid Board" that allows me to send the issue to any sprint that has not yet been completed on any Rapid Board on which the issue currently appears.

While allowing issues to be assigned to sprints that have already started in addition to sprints that have not yet started is not good scrum practice, it happens in reality and the control should not restrict the user from doing so,  (though it could be useful to indicate that the sprint is already in progress.)
fields.summary: As a scrum user I would like to be able to assign an issue to a sprint from the standard JIRA view issue page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Rapid Boards can be configured to use predefined sources of numbers or duration for estimation like Remaining Estimate field or numeric custom fields.

I would like to be able to declare another source of an estimation, providing a basic interface like {{Long getEstimation(Issue issue, Board board)}} (probably something a bit more complicated since you'll also need to know whether it's time or units).

The reason for that is that in Structure plugin, we have aggregation functions summing up values up the hierarchy (so far, the duration fields, but soon all summable fields) - and naturally, the customers ask us to see the same aggregate values on the Rapid Board when they do planning.

Thanks
Igor
fields.summary: As a JIRA plugin developer, I would like to provide GreenHopper with alternative sources of Estimation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi all,


It looks like after 6.0 version of Greenhopper, the Agile gadget has been renamed to "GreenHopper Classic Agile Gadget". Please confirm this and update the documentation here : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Agile+Gadget.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Update documentation for Agile Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Current Situation
There are 3 default swimlanes : Query-based, Assignee, and Story. However, only Query-based swimlanes can be disabled.

h3. Feature Request
It would be useful if the other default swimlanes (Assignee and Story) can be disabled as well.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of default swimlanes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Original summary "Turn the timestamp in the Rapid Board into a link to the comment in JIRA"

The dates in the comment should be permalinks back to the actual comment in the jira issue.
fields.summary: Ability to link to comment in JIRA View Issue from Agile detail view

fields.description:
See screenshot.

The user did not have Create Shared Objects permission (user *readonly* in the QA dataset).

A separate bug is that they were able to 'Create Board' in the first place.
fields.summary: Create Dialog does not display error messages

fields.description: JIRA has had the {{Class.js}} file for a while and has been using is for a simplified backbone-style inheritance model. However PrototypeJS is overriding the Class namespace which is breaking JIRA's code
fields.summary: PrototypeJS is overriding the window.Class object which is breaking JIRA code

fields.summary: Make error box dismissable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Build Epics prototype for user testing this sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour

The Velocity Chart report has the incorrect grammar, as below and in the attached screenshot:
{quote}
Use the Velocity Report to track {color:red}the{color} the amount of work completed from sprint to sprint. The average amount of work completed is the velocity and estimates the work the team can realistically achieve in future sprints.
{quote}

h3. Expected Behaviour

The additional 'the' is not present.

h3. Replication

*Agile > Board > Report*
fields.summary: Velocity Chart description has an extra 'the'

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: clauseValues is empty when accessing the Velocity and Burndown reports on the new boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6007].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On the new boards, the Burndown chart is not burning the sub-tasks estimation, only the parent issue. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Points assigned to the subtasks will also count towards the completion of the sprint and display in the Burndown chart. 

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Burndown chart doesn't take under consideration the sub-tasks estimation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, when the session timesout in the Agile view, instead of being redirected to the login page, the Greenhopper Rapid Start: https://test.jira.com/secure/RapidStart.jspa.  is displayed. It would be a good improvement if it would redirect to the login page.
fields.summary: Redirect to the login page when session timesout

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
While planning a Sprint on Rapid Board if added more than 999h on the Sprint it will not show the sum of sprint hours.

h5. Steps to reproduce:

1- Add more than 999 hours to any issue; (it will show properly)
!Plan mode 1.png|thumbnail!

2- Go to Report view then go back to Plan Mode;
!Plan mode 2.png|thumbnail!

The best example of the problem:
!Plan mode 3.png|thumbnail!

h5. Environment:
JIRA 5.0.6 to 5.1.3
GreenHopper 6.0.1 to 6.0.3
fields.summary: Plan mode not showing sum of hours

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the agile gadget doesn't consider sprints without any resolved issues while calculating the velocity.

As a Scrum Master I wan't an option for the Agile Gadget to include all the sprints despite the absence of resolved issues so that the average velocity is correctly calculated.

This improvement is a result of the support request https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-138603
fields.summary: Optional inclusion of all sprints despite the absence of resolved issues within Agile Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: That would be great if the issue cards in Rapid can have the summary view (just like the classic board). Please refer to the attached screenshots for more details.
fields.summary: Add several fields in the summary view in the Rapid Board cards (like the classic board)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: iOS6 now allows file attachments so the previous reason to disable this is no longer valid.
fields.summary: Re-enable Attach File button for Touch devices

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Logged out users are redirected to the getting started page when they don't have permission to view the manage board or board list pages

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
While using JIRA with TimeZone set to America/Bogota (either system timezone or the JVM timezone), Planning Boards with greater than ~900 issues never render, and instead send org.joda.time.tz.CachedDate.TimeZone.getOffset into what appears to be an infinite loop.

No timeout is triggered at either server or browser, so the page neither loads nor fails to load.
fields.summary: Large Planning Boards never load nor timeout if JIRA is in time zone America/Bogota

fields.summary: document that the Add sprint button is disabled when the board filter is not ordered by Rank

As a Project Administrator I would like the ability to choose which fields will show on the Sprint Report such as (Components, Assignee, etc.)

!Sprint Report.png|thumbnail!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Sprint name should has at least 80 characters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a team-member or product owner
I want to see issues in the ongoing sprint ordered according to priority
so that I know what issue to fix next.

When I view the current sprint in my "Work-tab" (rapidBoard.jspa?...view=detail) I want to view all my items ordered with highest priority on top. This is true for issues without subtasks. If however, I have subtasks among the issues, those issues together with the subtasks are displayed on top. I cannot figure out their priority in relation to the other issues.
fields.summary: Display issues with subtasks according to priority

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Rank to top/bottom do not work for multiple global rank field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS: 
- Dates will split to two edits
- Dates will behave like existing inline edit in work mode dialog
- When you edit the name you'll just be editing the name inline

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What happens when clicking between open inline edits?
A: Clicking from a name to a date picker will submit the name (if changed) and activate the edit for the date picker. Clicking between date pickers will change the currently edited date picker, as choosing a new date will automatically stop editing after the new date is saved.

If there is an error in a field, clicking away from the field will not keep the field in edit mode.

Q: Are foreign date formats properly supported?
A: Tested with Swedish locale - there is still the AM/PM time code, but that is a JIRA issue.

Q: Inline edit works in all browsers?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to inline edit sprint name, start and end date at the top of plan mode so that KA styles make sense

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When a project name is too long, the layout for the Create Board modal window is broken. Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Layout broken in Create Board modal window

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
* Click on the summary field in the details view to activate inline edit
* Click on another field (e.g. the description field) it must be the next click you make

The description field will become focused but not enter the edit mode.

Cause:
Due to the summary field switching from edit to read mode on a blur, the description field moves from underneath your cursor. This means that the click event is not registered.
fields.summary: After editing the summary in the detail view, you cannot click on another field to edit it. Another click is required

fields.description:
It is all described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Calendar._SDN+is+Undefined+in+GreenHopper+in+Swedish
In a nutshell, GreenHopper 6.0.1 and 6.0.2 throw an error in a Swedish Kanban Board.

6.0.3 works fine and English also.

fields.description:
The Administer Project link has disappeared off the GREENHOPPER Agile screens after migration from JIRA Studio to AOD. This is where users have been accessing it but it has gone from both the Classic and the new Boards. With the current configuration, the Project Leads can't get into some of the configurable aspects of their projects unless they use the Classic board (for Version creation only by using the Add button). This is causing inconveniences among teams. 

GreenHopper Version in JIRA Studio is: 5.7
GreenHopper Version in AOD is: 6.02
fields.summary: "Administer Project" link is no longer available in the GREENHOPPER Agile screens

fields.description: Currently you are forced to use the latest sprint, but on some occasions we find we would like to start working on the next sprint, but the current one is not released yet. I know this is technically not sticking to the rules of agile, but this stuff happens in our world. Moving stories to the current sprint is not an option for us we are then changing the burn down and we dont want to do that.
